channel.title: University on gself
channel.description: Recent content in University on gself

item.title: Discipline Success
item.description: This week I took a look at the “Course Benchmark Report” at the Arizona ASSIST site, where data about students who transfer from our college to any of the public universities is available. This report shows the success rate for our students. {"x":{"url":"/post/disc-success/index_files/figure-html//widgets/widget_topTable.html","options":{"xdomain":"*","allowfullscreen":false,"lazyload":false}},"evals":[],"jsHooks":[]} I suppose that the first fact that jumped out at me was the number of Computer Science and English students who transfer; no other discipline comes very close to those numbers.

item.title: University Transfer Student Characteristics
item.description: The state of Arizona maintains a database that tracks students who transfer from one of our community colleges to one of our publicly-funded universities. That database includes a huge amount of information about transfer students and from time-to-time, I’ll share something from that database in my blog. For today, the following table lists some general characteristics about our transfer students over the past five years. Characteristics 12-13 13-14 14-15 15-16 16-17 17-18 Change Total 10267 10507 10696 10821 10853 10257 -0.
